items.restartSetupHint: Re-run the welcome wizard (data is kept)

about.description: Track contractions, assess labor patterns, know when to go to the hospital.
about.privacyNotice: All data stays on this device. No accounts, no servers, no tracking.

devtools.seedHint: Replace current session with realistic mock data for testing.
devtools.debugLoggingHint: Capture diagnostic data while testing features. Copy the log and paste it to share.
devtools.copyLogDesc: Copies full diagnostic log to clipboard
devtools.archivePrompt: You have {count, plural, one {# contraction} other {# contractions}} in your current session.

welcomeState.title: Contraction Timer
welcomeState.description: Tap the button below when a contraction starts. Tap again when it ends.

heroAction.tapStartPrompt: Tap start when a contraction begins

stageActions.transition: You should be at the hospital

contractionMessages.transition: One at a time — you've got this

heroAction.waterBrokeActive: Water broke + active labor — head to hospital
heroAction.waterBrokeTransition: You should be at the hospital

timerPage.sharingBanner: Sharing with {count, plural, one {# partner} other {# partners}}

emptyState.title: No data yet
emptyState.hint: Start timing contractions to see patterns, wave charts, and labor stage analysis here.

progression.estimateReach: At this pace, may reach {rule} in ~{minutes} min
progression.disclaimer: Based on last {count} interval{count, plural, one {} other {s}} (this session)

braxtonHicks.disclaimer: This is a pattern estimate, not a diagnosis.

emptyState.title: No contractions yet
emptyState.hint: Your contraction history will appear here. Tap each entry to edit timing, intensity, or location.

locationHint.enRoute: Travel time removed — estimates show time from now
locationHint.uncertain: Travel time unknown — using ~30 min conservative estimate
locationHint.withTravel: {minutes} min travel time included in estimates

rule511.explainerInterval: Interval — average time between contraction starts within the analysis window. Checked (✓) when average ≤ {target} min.
rule511.explainerDuration: Duration — average length of timed contractions (start to stop). Checked when average ≥ {target}s. A 64s contraction counts as "over 1 minute."
rule511.explainerSustained: Sustained — how long the pattern has been going. Measured as the span from your first to most recent contraction. Checked when ≥ {target} min.
rule511.explainerNote: These are clinical guidelines (ACOG), not absolute rules. Your provider may recommend different thresholds (e.g. 4-1-1 or 3-1-1). Adjust in settings.

waterBreakInfo.addProviderPhone: Add provider phone for quick call access
waterBreakInfo.safetyNote: Note fluid color. Clear/pale yellow is normal. Green/brown → call immediately.
waterBreakInfo.statReassure: Most people start labor naturally within a day

clinicalReference.dilationNote: Dilation = opening of uterus (0 cm = closed, 10 cm = fully open)

preLabor.description: Irregular tightenings that come and go. Not true labor yet — your body is warming up.

early.description: Contractions are becoming more regular and closer together. You can still talk through them.

active.description: Strong, regular contractions. Requires focused breathing. This is when most people head to the hospital.

transition.description: The most intense but shortest phase. You may feel pressure, nausea, and an urge to push.

clinicalReference.bhIntro: Compare your symptoms to help distinguish practice from real labor.

bhDescriptions.restBH: Stop with movement or position change
bhDescriptions.restReal: Do not stop with rest or movement
bhDescriptions.locationReal: Radiate from back or wrap around
bhDescriptions.intensityBH: Do not get stronger over time

warningSigns.bleeding: Vaginal bleeding like a period or heavier
warningSigns.babyMovement: Baby stops moving or moves much less
warningSigns.abdominalPain: Severe abdominal pain that does not ease

clinicalReference.disclaimer: General guidelines only. Always follow your provider's instructions.

emptyState.title: Labor advisor
emptyState.hint: Record at least 3 contractions to see 5-1-1 progress, departure advice, and time estimates.

details.notEnoughData: Record more contractions to get departure advice.
details.transition: Transition-phase contractions detected. You should be at or heading to the hospital.
details.waterAndActive: Water has broken and contractions are in the active pattern. Head to the hospital.
details.waterBroken: Water has broken. Contact your provider for guidance on when to head in.
details.rule511Met: Contractions match the 5-1-1 pattern. Time to head to the hospital.
details.estimatedLeaveSoon: At current pace, 5-1-1 pattern expected in ~{minutes} min. Consider leaving soon.
details.progressing: Progressing toward 5-1-1. Estimated ~{minutes} min at current pace.
details.activeLabor: Active labor pattern detected. Stay in close contact with your provider.
details.earlyLabor: Early labor — contractions are present but still spaced out. Rest and conserve energy.
details.irregular: Contractions are irregular. Continue monitoring for a consistent pattern.

factors.travelUnknownConservative: Travel time unknown — using 30 min estimate

recommendations.keepTracking: Keep timing contractions to build a pattern.
recommendations.shouldBeAtHospital: You should be at or heading to the hospital.
recommendations.activeBagReady: Have your bag ready. Active labor is progressing.
recommendations.earlyStayHome: Stay home and rest. Early labor can last many hours.
recommendations.irregularContinue: Continue monitoring. Pattern is not yet consistent.

pattern.notEnoughData: Not enough data for pattern analysis

situation.title: Your situation
situation.firstBabyHint: First labors typically last longer. This affects time estimates and stage duration ranges.

display.title: Display
display.heroHint: Info card above the timer: stage label, action suggestion, or compact elapsed time.
display.sessionBreakHint: Gaps longer than this are shown as separate sessions in the wave chart and trend analysis.
display.stageTimerHint: How stage duration is calculated: from last contraction or continuously.

features.title: Features
features.showTargetLinesHint: Colored reference lines on the wave chart when contractions hit your timing targets.
features.trendAnalysisHint: Linear regression on recent contractions to detect shortening intervals and longer durations.
features.patternAssessmentHint: Weighted scoring of 6 criteria (regularity, duration trend, intensity, location, interval trend, sustained activity) to distinguish real labor from Braxton Hicks.
features.hospitalAdvisorHint: Departure timing advice on the Advisor page based on your contraction pattern.
features.contextualTipsHint: Stage-appropriate guidance cards on the Timer and Advisor pages.
features.thresholdRuleHint: Show 5-1-1 (or custom) rule progress on the labor advisor page.
features.clinicalReferenceHint: Labor guide on the Advisor page: stages, Braxton Hicks comparison, and warning signs.

advisor.title: Advisor
advisor.introDesc: These three settings work together: Detail level controls how much info the advisor shows. Alert timing shifts when "time to go" appears. Travel time adds buffer so you leave with time to spare.
advisor.detailLevelHint: Controls how much detail the hospital advisor shows: time ranges, urgency level, or a single-line summary.
advisor.travelTimeHint: How long it takes to reach your hospital. Factored into departure timing.
advisor.alertTimingHint: Conservative alerts you earlier, relaxed waits longer. Affects when you see "time to go" advice.

threshold.title: Threshold rule
threshold.desc: The N-1-1 rule is clinical guidance (ACOG) for when to head to the hospital. Standard is 5-1-1: contractions 5 minutes apart, 1 minute long, for 1 hour. Your provider may recommend 3-1-1, 4-1-1, or other variations — adjust below.
threshold.detailDesc: Each criterion uses the average of recent contractions within the analysis window, not a single contraction. A contraction lasting 64s counts as "over 1 minute." These are guidelines, not absolute rules — always follow your provider's advice.
threshold.intervalHint: Average time between contraction starts (start-to-start). Checked when average ≤ this value.
threshold.durationHint: Average contraction length (start to stop). Checked when average ≥ this value.
threshold.sustainedHint: Total span from first to most recent contraction. Checked when ≥ this value, confirming the pattern is consistent, not a one-off cluster.

advanced.title: Advanced
advanced.stageThresholdsDesc: Define contraction patterns for each labor stage. Based on ACOG guidelines. Max interval = longest gap between contractions; min duration = shortest contraction length.
advanced.bhThresholdsDesc: Fine-tune how we distinguish practice contractions from real labor. Most users should leave these at defaults.

extras.title: Extras
extras.prayersHint: Show the Prayers tab in the menu. Always visible on Cathedral and Shire themes.

sharing.liveQuickModeDesc: Uses a relay to find your partner. Works across any network.
sharing.passwordHintVisible: Share this passphrase with your partner
sharing.privacyNote: All SDP data is encrypted before leaving your device. STUN only sees your IP. TURN relays encrypted data — cannot read content.
sharing.privateConnectDesc: Connect by exchanging invite codes manually — no relay server touches your data.
sharing.privateStep1: One person creates an invite and shares the code
sharing.privateStep2: The other person accepts and sends back a response code
sharing.connectionLimitationsText: Without a TURN relay server, this only works reliably on the same WiFi network. Connections across different networks (mobile data, different WiFi, corporate firewalls) will usually fail because NAT/firewall rules block direct peer-to-peer traffic.
sharing.connectionLimitationsAdvice: For reliable cross-network connections, use Quick Connect with a Cloudflare Worker relay instead — it's free, takes 2 minutes to set up, and works everywhere.
sharing.hostStep1Label: Step 1: Share this with your partner
sharing.guestSendCodeLabel: Send this code back to your partner
sharing.waitingForPartnerToEnterCode: Waiting for partner to enter code...
sharing.cameraErrorHttps: Camera requires HTTPS. This page is not in a secure context.
sharing.cameraErrorUnavailable: Camera API not available in this browser.
sharing.cameraErrorPermission: Camera permission denied. Check your browser settings.
sharing.cameraErrorNotFound: No camera found on this device.

serverOptions.stunGoogleDesc: Free, reliable. Google sees your IP during the STUN request.
serverOptions.stunCloudflareDesc: Privacy-focused alternative. Cloudflare sees your IP.
serverOptions.stunNoneDesc: No STUN server. Only works on the same local network.
serverOptions.stunCustomDesc: Enter your own STUN server URL.
serverOptions.turnOpenRelayDesc: Free public relay. Relays encrypted data if direct connection fails.
serverOptions.turnCloudflareDesc: Requires a Cloudflare account with TURN enabled.
serverOptions.turnNoneDesc: No TURN relay. Direct connections only.
serverOptions.turnCustomDesc: Enter your own TURN server details.

privateTurnHint.detail: If you have your own TURN server credentials, select 'Custom' above and enter them. TURN relays encrypted data when direct peer-to-peer connections fail due to restrictive NAT or firewalls.

snapshot.sendTooltip: Sends a frozen copy of your session data. The recipient gets a one-time snapshot, not a live connection.
snapshot.sendDesc: Share a one-time copy of your session. Your partner gets a frozen snapshot — not a live connection.
snapshot.sendDescSettingsOnly: Share your setup and preferences with your partner or another device — no session data required.
snapshot.alwaysIncludedHint: Session data (contractions, events) is always included.
snapshot.settingsOnlyHint: No session data yet — only your selected settings will be shared.
snapshot.qrCodeTooLargeTitle: Session data is too large for a QR code
snapshot.shortCodeDisabledTitle: Set up a relay in server options to enable short codes
snapshot.qrTooLargeError: Session data too large for QR code ({charCount} chars, max ~2900). Use copy link or short code instead.
snapshot.emptyDesc: Start tracking contractions, then come back here to share your data with your partner or another device.
snapshot.receiveIntro: Import session data shared by your partner or from another device.
snapshot.receiveMethodQr: Scan a QR code with your camera
snapshot.receiveMethodLink: Paste a share link from your partner
snapshot.receiveMethodShortCode: Enter a short code (if using a relay)
snapshot.importPlaceholder: Paste a link, short code, or compressed data here...
snapshot.previewCurrentSessionHint: You have {count} contraction{count, plural, one {} other {s}} in your current session.
snapshot.importErrorUnrecognized: Could not recognize this as a snapshot link, code, or data
snapshot.importErrorRelayRequired: Short codes require a relay server. Set one up in server options.

deploy.tierBasicDesc: Uses free public servers. Works on the same WiFi network. Cross-network connections may be unreliable.
deploy.tierBasicConfig: ntfy.sh + Google STUN + Open Relay TURN
deploy.tierAdvancedDesc: Works everywhere. Free. Takes 2 minutes. No credit card needed.
deploy.step1Desc: You'll need a free GitHub and Cloudflare account. Cloudflare creates a copy of the relay code and deploys it for you.
deploy.step2Desc: After deploying, Cloudflare shows your URL. It looks like ct-signaling.you.workers.dev. Select "My Cloudflare Worker" in the dropdown above and paste it in.
deploy.step3Title: Share the URL with your partner
deploy.step3Desc: Your partner pastes the same URL into their app. Only one person needs to deploy — both use the same relay.
deploy.tierSelfHostedDesc: Run your own signaling server + TURN relay. Zero third-party dependencies.

onboarding.welcomeDesc: Track contractions, see patterns, and know when it's time to go to the hospital.
onboarding.welcomePrivacyNote: All data stays on this device. No accounts needed.
onboarding.quickSetupDesc: Two quick questions to personalize your experience.
onboarding.travelTimeUncertainHint: No problem — we'll use a conservative estimate and give you a range.
onboarding.providerPhoneHint: Quick-dial from the app when it's time to call.
onboarding.readyDesc: Tap the big button when a contraction starts. Tap again when it ends. The app does the rest.

bh.stopWithMovement: Stop with movement or position change
bh.notStronger: Do not get stronger over time

real.noStop: Do not stop with rest or movement
real.radiateBack: Radiate from back or wrap around

tips.firstContraction: Great start! Keep timing contractions to see if a pattern develops. Most first labors start slowly.
tips.prelaborNormal: Irregular contractions are normal and can come and go for days. If they stop when you move or rest, it may be Braxton Hicks.
tips.earlyRest: Early labor can last 6-12+ hours for first-time parents. Try to rest, especially if it is nighttime.
tips.earlyHydrate: Stay hydrated and eat light snacks. You will need the energy for active labor.
tips.earlyActivity: Light activity like walking can help labor progress during the day.
tips.earlyTiming: You are likely still at home during early labor. Head to the hospital when contractions reach the 5-1-1 pattern.
tips.activeEntered: Active labor means steady progress. If you are not at the hospital yet, it is time to go.
tips.activeBreathing: Focus on slow, deep breathing through each contraction. In through the nose, out through the mouth.
tips.activeDuration: Active labor typically lasts 3-5 hours for first-time parents. You are making real progress.
tips.transitionEntered: Transition is the shortest but most intense phase. You are almost there.
tips.transitionNormal: Feeling overwhelmed, nauseous, or shaky is normal during transition. It typically lasts 30 minutes to 2 hours.
tips.waterNoteColor: Note the color of the fluid. Clear or pale yellow is normal. Green or brown means call your provider immediately.
tips.waterCallProvider: Contact your provider to let them know your water broke. They will advise on next steps.
tips.waterStats: 77-95% of people go into active labor within 24 hours of their water breaking.
tips.nightSleep: Try to sleep between contractions if possible. Rest now will help you through active labor later.
tips.backLabor: Back labor can be eased by hands-and-knees position, hip squeezes, or a warm compress on your lower back.
tips.safetyCall: Call your provider immediately if: heavy bleeding, baby stops moving, severe headache with vision changes, or fever above 100.4°F.
tips.patternRegular: Your contractions are becoming more regular. This is a good sign that labor is progressing.

sessionManager.archiveConfirmPrompt: Archive current session and start fresh?

devotional.footerTranslation: The peace of the Lord be always with you.

gerardMajella.name: St. Gerard Majella
gerardMajella.title: Patron of expectant mothers
gerardMajella.detail: An 18th-century Redemptorist lay brother whose intercession is sought by mothers for safe delivery and healthy children.

giannaMolla.name: St. Gianna Beretta Molla
giannaMolla.title: Patron of mothers & unborn children
giannaMolla.detail: An Italian physician and mother who sacrificed her life for her unborn child in 1962. Canonized by Pope John Paul II in 2004.

raymondNonnatus.name: St. Raymond Nonnatus
raymondNonnatus.title: Patron of childbirth & midwives
raymondNonnatus.detail: A 13th-century Mercedarian friar named "non natus" (not born) because he was delivered by caesarean section after his mother's death.

margaretAntioch.name: St. Margaret of Antioch
margaretAntioch.title: Patron of childbirth
margaretAntioch.detail: A virgin martyr of the early Church, invoked for centuries by women in labor. One of the Fourteen Holy Helpers.

ourLadyLaLeche.name: Our Lady of La Leche
ourLadyLaLeche.title: Patroness of nursing mothers
ourLadyLaLeche.detail: A beloved devotion to the Blessed Virgin Mary honoring her as a nursing mother, with a shrine in St. Augustine, Florida since 1615.

colette.name: St. Colette
colette.title: Patron of pregnant women & women in childbirth
colette.detail: A 14th-century French Poor Clare nun known for reforming her order. A stillborn child was said to have been revived after she wrapped it in her veil.

felicity.name: St. Felicity
felicity.title: Patron of expectant mothers
felicity.detail: A 2nd-century woman imprisoned and sentenced to death for her Christian faith while pregnant. Her execution was delayed until after she gave birth in prison.

elizabeth.name: St. Elizabeth
elizabeth.title: Patron of expectant mothers
elizabeth.detail: Cousin of the Blessed Virgin Mary and mother of St. John the Baptist. Called "blessed among women," she conceived her son in her old age by the grace of God.

anne.name: St. Anne
anne.title: Patron of grandmothers & women in labor
anne.detail: Mother of the Blessed Virgin Mary. Venerated since the early Church for conceiving and bearing Mary later in life. Her name means "grace."

monica.name: St. Monica
monica.title: Patron of mothers
monica.detail: A 4th-century mother of St. Augustine of Hippo. She endured great hardship during pregnancy with an abusive husband, yet her faith and perseverance brought her son to conversion.

zelieMartin.name: St. ZÃ©lie Martin
zelieMartin.title: Patron of mothers & grieving parents
zelieMartin.detail: A 19th-century French mother who lost four of her nine children in infancy. Canonized in 2015 alongside her husband Louis. Mother of St. ThÃ©rÃ¨se of Lisieux.

joseph.name: St. Joseph
joseph.title: Patron of families, fathers & the Universal Church
joseph.detail: The foster father of Jesus and spouse of the Blessed Virgin Mary. Known as "Terror of Demons" for his powerful protection over the Holy Family. Patron of a happy death, workers, and the universal Church.

stGerard.title: Prayer to St. Gerard for Safe Delivery
stGerard.text: O great St. Gerard, beloved servant of Jesus Christ, perfect imitator of thy meek and humble Savior, and devoted child of the Mother of God: enrich me with thy blessing before, during, and after the birth of my child. Through thy intercession may I experience a safe and happy delivery. May my child be brought safely into this world and be raised as a true child of God. Amen.

memorare.title: The Memorare
memorare.text: Remember, O most gracious Virgin Mary, that never was it known that anyone who fled to thy protection, implored thy help, or sought thy intercession was left unaided. Inspired by this confidence, I fly unto thee, O Virgin of virgins, my Mother. To thee do I come, before thee I stand, sinful and sorrowful. O Mother of the Word Incarnate, despise not my petitions, but in thy mercy hear and answer me. Amen.
memorare.attribution: Attributed to St. Bernard of Clairvaux

motherAndChild.title: Prayer for Mother and Child
motherAndChild.text: Lord Jesus Christ, who was carried in the womb of the Blessed Virgin Mary, look with mercy upon this mother and her child. Grant her strength in labor, courage in pain, and joy in new life. May the child be born in safety and health, and may both mother and child rest under thy loving protection. Through the intercession of Mary, Mother of God, and all the holy mothers and saints, we ask this in thy name. Amen.

hailMary.title: Hail Mary
hailMary.text: Hail Mary, full of grace, the Lord is with thee. Blessed art thou amongst women, and blessed is the fruit of thy womb, Jesus. Holy Mary, Mother of God, pray for us sinners, now and at the hour of our death. Amen.

ourLadyLaLeche.title: Prayer to Our Lady of La Leche
ourLadyLaLeche.text: Lovely Lady of La Leche, most loving Mother of the Child Jesus, and my mother, I come to ask your help. I believe in God's power, and I place all my trust in you. Grant me the grace of motherhood. Assist me, dear Lady, in this my longing, and if it be the Holy Will of God for me to conceive, obtain for me the grace of carrying my child to term. Through the intercession of Thy Holy Mother and the merits of her divine Son, have mercy on us. Amen.
ourLadyLaLeche.attribution: Traditional â Shrine of Our Lady of La Leche, St. Augustine, FL

safeDelivery.title: Prayer for a Safe Delivery
safeDelivery.text: Lord Jesus, I place my baby and myself into your loving hands. Calm my fears, strengthen my body, and guide those who care for us. May this birth be safe and filled with your peace. I trust in your plan for our lives. Amen.

stJoseph.title: Prayer to St. Joseph, Protector of Families
stJoseph.text: O St. Joseph, whose protection is so great, so strong, so prompt before the throne of God, I place in thee all my interests and desires. O St. Joseph, assist me by thy powerful intercession and obtain for me all spiritual blessings through thy foster Son, Jesus Christ our Lord, so that, having engaged here below thy heavenly power, I may offer my thanksgiving and homage. O St. Joseph, Terror of Demons, pray for us and for our family. Guard this mother and child with thy fatherly care. Amen.
stJoseph.attribution: Traditional Catholic Prayer to St. Joseph

psalm139.title: Psalm 139:13–16 — Knit Together
psalm139.text: For you created my inmost being; you knit me together in my mother’s womb. I praise you because I am fearfully and wonderfully made; your works are wonderful, I know that full well. My frame was not hidden from you when I was made in the secret place, when I was woven together in the depths of the earth. Your eyes saw my unformed body; all the days ordained for me were written in your book before one of them came to be.

isaiah66.title: Isaiah 66:9 — Promise of Delivery
isaiah66.text: Do I bring to the moment of birth and not give delivery? says the Lord. Do I close up the womb when I bring to delivery? says your God.

jeremiah1.title: Jeremiah 1:5 — Known Before Birth
jeremiah1.text: Before I formed you in the womb I knew you, before you were born I set you apart.

magnificat.title: The Magnificat (Canticle of Mary)
magnificat.text: My soul proclaims the greatness of the Lord, my spirit rejoices in God my Savior, for he has looked with favor on his lowly servant. From this day all generations will call me blessed: the Almighty has done great things for me, and holy is his Name.

relay.responseSentDesc: The response code was sent to your sharing session. You can close this tab.
